This topic was moved here from #Geographic locality > Exercises for an event by Kevin Buzzard.

Dear friends I wanted to know if there is a possibility of a private channel or thread where you can post exercises for your students like the one above without everyone seeing it except maybe those who have a link or access code.
If all your students are on the Zulip then it is possible to set up a private channel, just google for how to do it. edit: here https://zulip.com/help/channel-permissions#private-channels
I don't think they'll have permissions to do that with how we have Zulip set up.
Yes, you would have to request that we create a channel for you, and choose a maintainer to be a moderator (just in case)
#Zulip meta > creating channels @ ðŸ’¬ is the discussion that's relevant, I think

@Yagub Aliyev while the maintainers are trying to remember the policy for moderation of private channels, perhaps you could take a while explaining something about the course and what you intend to use the channel for.

Yes. On Monday I gave a lecture to high school students about set theory and its history. I promised them to explain how to formalize set theory theorems and their proofs on lean4. On this Wednesday I will demonstrate Set Theory Game and solve some of the tasks there. On Friday I want to solve some set theory exercises using zulip chat and zulip's lean windows. The students already have necessary links to register in zulip and play the game. I asked them not to post unnecessary messages on zulip. This will be the first such event in Azerbaijan. I hope that it will be useful for them.
The maintainers are actively discussing this issue and will hopefully come back to you with a decision later today. Sorry for the delay.
